Course.title: Course
Course.description: Represents a cybersecurity course offered by DevAura Labs.

description.description: Detailed description of the course content.

icon.description: Icon representing the course (e.g., URL to an image).

level.description: Difficulty level of the course (e.g., Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced).

SkillDevelopmentProgram.title: SkillDevelopmentProgram
SkillDevelopmentProgram.description: Represents a skill development program offered by DevAura Labs.

id.description: Unique identifier for the skill development program.

title.description: Title of the skill development program.

progress.description: User's progress in the program (e.g., percentage completed).

WebsiteRequest.title: WebsiteRequest
WebsiteRequest.description: Represents a request for a website creation service.

id.description: Unique identifier for the website request.

description.description: Detailed description of the website requirements.

deadline.description: Desired deadline for the website creation.

status.description: Current status of the website request (e.g., Pending, In Progress, Completed).

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the DevAura Labs platform.

ChatSession.title: ChatSession
ChatSession.description: Represents a single chat session for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the chat session.

title.description: A title for the chat session, often the first user message.

timestamp.description: Server timestamp of when the session was created or last updated.

userId.description: The ID of the user who owns this chat session.

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a single message within a chat session.

timestamp.description: Server timestamp of when the message was sent.

courses.description: Optional list of course recommendations included in the message.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, DBAC, and QAPs. User data is stored under `/users/{userId}`. Website requests and chat sessions are stored as subcollections under each user (`/users/{userId}/website_requests/{websiteRequestId}` and `/users/{userId}/chats/{chatId}` respectively), ensuring clear ownership and easy querying of a user's data. Messages are a subcollection of chats. Denormalization is applied by including the `userId` field within documents where necessary. Courses and skill development programs are stored in top-level collections for public access. This structure facilitates robust, path-based security rules.
